title: FIX VEIGARS PASSIVE RITO
body:
Or im gonna Cry :'(
Just so you guys know veigars passive is equilibrium: restores 1% of mana For every 1% missing
and with the new mana system rito created veigars passive no longer works

replies.body:
Well his passive increases is *mana regen* by 1% for ever 1% mana missing.

Edit: Tested in game. It is definitely working.

So basically you get wayyyyyyyyyyyyy less regen now if you are used to building grail first(even moreso than other champs by a lot), but the same if you just rush dfg.

that seems right, I just don't feel viegars passive working at all it seems like I get no mana regen 
I hope rito buffs his mana regen or something

I would like to see veigars kit twiked to show that he is a master of magic
that includes changing his passive to like soccer's stone where it ranks up with his current ap bonus and maybe even gives his skills different effects
I mean would a true master only have 4 moves in his kit 
no
this is were i propose that certain combinations of his kit make his skills different 
say his q going through the prison walls would make his q travel longer or split shot. and his w with an immediate q would make a line of comets not just one or w in prison would hit the vertexes of the prison while also hitting the middle. 
I think veigar should get a rework to show his mastery of magic and not be a AP addict that focuses on burst damage only.

Try the chalice on Veigar, it's infinite mana~(15/s when you are low)

It still works and still buffs mana regeneration from items as well I believe. When you increase your mana regeneration to 125%, his passive should increase it to 250%. 150% to 300% and 175% to 350%. Also, I have played Veigar since the changes and it definitely works although I wish his base mana regeneration was higher to help work with his passive.

I think they should just change his passive altogether... Honestly, his passive is mana regen and his ability costs are some of the highest that I know of.... They should just lower his mana costs and give him an actually useful passive. Maybe increase his mana regen a little after, because early his poking consists of combos so he would need some mana regen.
